subject: Re: [junit] Re: Testing accessors...
msgSnippet: I really like it too, but it prompts me to make the observation that programmers (including myself) are SOOO weird. ... David Olivier Naval Research Laboratory
messageBody:
I really like it too, but it prompts me to make the observation that
programmers (including myself) are SOOO weird.

At 02:25 PM 6/5/2002 -0700, you wrote:
>HAHAH...very nice, I like that :)
>
>-Eric
>
>--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@...>
>wrote:
> > > Personally, I tend not to test simple getters and
> > > setters. I may, however, after an incident a few
> > > weeks ago (which caused my partner and I to waste
> > a
> > > good 45 minutes), test any constructors that set
> > > member variables, even if they look simple.
> >
> > That's the way testing goes:
> >
> > becomeTimidAndTestEverything
> > while writingTheSameThingOverAndOverAgain
> > becomeMoreAggressive
> > writeFewerTests
> > writeTestsForMoreInterestingCases
> > if getBurnedByStupidDefect
> > feelStupid
> > becomeTimidAndTestEverything
> > end
> > end
> >
> > The loop, as you can see, never terminates.
> >
> > --
> > J. B. Rainsberger,
> > President, Diaspar Software Services
> > Let's write software that people understand.
> > http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
> > telephone: +1 416 791-8603
> >
>
>
